newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine Senate fails to pass tax bill.
newsitem.headline: Philippine Senate fails to pass tax bill.

text.p: The Philippine Senate ended its session on Thursday without passing a much-awaited tax reform bill.
The chamber expects to pass the measure in August when Congress resumes session on July 22.

Senate ways and means committee chairman Juan Ponce Enrile said the Palace should not expect the chamber to pass a tax measure in just a few weeks when the lower house took its time in deliberating on the issue,
"I will hold exhaustive deliberations on this measure. Nobody can give us a deadline," Enrile told reporters.
Enrile said he would overhaul the version of the lower house which gave too many exemptions.
The bill is the last of a package of major tax reforms since President Fidel Ramos took office in 1992.
The bill, which aims to generate 18 billion pesos a year, would expand the number of people who pay income tax and overhaul the corporate income tax structure.
Its passage is essential for the country to exit more than 30 years of supervision under the International Monetary Fund. -- Manila Newsroom (63 2) 841-8937 Fax 817-6267
